key_insight: Combines specialized agents that analyze image, text, and contextual cues to detect depressive symptoms in memes, supported by a new dataset (RESTOREx) and collaborative reasoning. The multi-aspect, multi-agent design yields more nuanced symptom identification than single-stream models.
problem_solved: Automates identification of depressive symptoms expressed in multimodal memesâ€”a challenging task due to subtle humor, sarcasm, and the need to jointly interpret visual and textual cues.
method: Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent (MAMA) architecture: separate agents specialize in image, text, and contextual/social signals and communicate for joint inference.
Collaborative fusion and consensus: agents share evidence and reasoning (e.g., via a mediator or LLM) to produce symptom-level labels instead of single binary outputs.
Introduced RESTOREx: a curated multimodal dataset and annotation schema for depressive symptoms used to train and evaluate the model.
impact: Provides a practical multimodal modeling pattern and dataset for researchers building sensitive, fine-grained mental-health detection systems from social media content, improving interpretability and robustness over single-modality approaches.

paper_title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
paper_authors: Siddhant Agarwal, Adya Dhuler, Polly Ruhnke, Melvin Speisman, Md Shad Akhtar
